original: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa dang gtan bral mi 'gyur na ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa dang gtan bral mi 'gyur na ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the sravakas, etc., were not completely free from afflicted ignorance, they would not be free from the afflictions of karma and birth,

original: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Also, how is it that the three afflictions are eliminated for sravakas and pratyekabuddhas because they have nonafflicted ignorance?

original: nyon mongs pa can nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Because the cause of affliction is only affliction,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not nonaffliction.

original: yang ci shes rab dri ma med pa kho na chos mngon pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang ci shes rab dri ma med pa kho na chos mngon pa yin nam /
translated: Also, is only stainless wisdom abhidharma?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rjes 'brang bcas te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rjes 'brang bcas te /
translated: Then what? It is accompanied by its following.

original: shes rab kyi 'khor dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag dang dge ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'khor dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag dang dge ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form and so on that is virtuous and accompanies wisdom is its following.

original: de la mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan dang bsam gtan khyad par can la rten pa'i shes rab la ni gang gis gang de skad du bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'cho bas bstabs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'iüîΩgzugs dang rjes su 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan dang bsam gtan khyad par can la rten pa'i shes rab la ni gang gis gang de skad du bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'cho bas bstabs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dang rjes su 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: It is because wisdom is the dominant condition of all mental factors and it is the dominant condition of the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes.üîΩIf you ask, why is it that wisdom is not concomitant with the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes that are explained in that way?üîΩIt is because wisdom is the dominant condition of all mental factors and it is the dominant condition of the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes.üîΩIf you ask, why is it that wisdom is not concomitant with the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes that are explained in that way?

original: gal te sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rten yin pas sems gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de nyid dri ma med pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa chos mngon pa rig mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rten yin pas sems gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de nyid dri ma med pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa chos mngon pa rig mod ce na /
translated: It is because wisdom is the dominant condition of all mental factors and it is the dominant condition of the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes.üîΩIf you ask, why is it that wisdom is not concomitant with the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes that are explained in that way?

original: bya ba dang mthong ba dang dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa la nus pa dang ldan pas shes rab kho na gtso bo yin no //üîΩrjes su 'brang ba dang bcas zhes kho nar bstan pa ni thos pa las byung @216b pa la sogs pa yang sbyar te /
analyzed: bya ba dang mthong ba dang dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa la nus pa dang ldan pas shes rab kho na gtso bo yin no //üîΩrjes su 'brang ba dang bcas zhes kho nar bstan pa ni thos pa las byung @216b pa la sogs pa yang sbyar te /
translated: It is because wisdom is the dominant condition of all mental factors and it is the dominant condition of the uncontaminated path of action and the uncontaminated path of abodes.

original: skye nas thob pa phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa ltar thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: skye nas thob pa phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa ltar thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: That arisen from hearing and that arisen from contemplation are by nature the four aggregates, just as that obtained from birth is.

original: bsgoms byung ni phung po lnga pa ste /
analyzed: bsgoms byung ni phung po lnga pa ste /
translated: That arisen from meditation is five aggregates,

original: nyer bsdogs dang / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dang / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the restraint of absorption exists in access concentration, the four absorptions and special absorption.

original: nye bar bsdogs pa rnams dang gzugs med pa bzhi ni phung po bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsdogs pa rnams dang gzugs med pa bzhi ni phung po bzhi pa'o //
translated: Access concentrations and the four formless states are four aggregates.

original: de lta na 'o na mdo sde la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi rnam pa thams cad zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi tshogs su gyur pas chos mngon pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na mdo sde la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi rnam pa thams cad zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi tshogs su gyur pas chos mngon pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since all aspects of the Tathagata's speech, such as the sutras, become the collection of uncontaminated wisdom, they would be abhidharma.

original: de ni de ltar yin mod kyi 'on kyang mdo sde ni phal cher gdul bya'i bsam pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yin mod kyi 'on kyang mdo sde ni phal cher gdul bya'i bsam pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin zhing /
translated: That is so, but the sutras are for the most part directed toward the minds of disciples.

original: 'dul ba ni byung bas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dul ba ni byung bas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: The Vinaya is distinguished by events.

original: mngon pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa kho na yin pas de kho na la chos mngon pa zhes ming du grags so //
analyzed: mngon pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa kho na yin pas de kho na la chos mngon pa zhes ming du grags so //
translated: Abhidharma is the direct approach to the characteristics of phenomena, and it is well known that it is called the Abhidharma because it is the direct approach to those characteristics.

original: de'i phyir gzhan la thob par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la thob par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not obtained by others.

original: yang dag par 'gro ba'i rnam grangs ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i 'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'gro ba'i rnam grangs ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i 'o //
translated: The enumeration of the correct approach is that of the elder ≈öƒÅriputra.

original: ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas gsung rab tu gyur pa na gnas brtan k'a ty'a'i bu la sogs pa mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis chos kyi rje'i dgongs pa dang chos nyid la ltos te bsdus shing tshoms su byas so //
analyzed: ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas gsung rab tu gyur pa na gnas brtan k'a ty'a'i bu la sogs pa mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis chos kyi rje'i dgongs pa dang chos nyid la ltos te bsdus shing tshoms su byas so //
translated: After the Teacher passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa, the elders such as KƒÅtyƒÅyanƒ´putra and so on, who possessed the higher perceptions, compiled and collected the scriptures in accordance with the intention of the Lord of Dharma and the nature of the Dharma.üîΩEnumeration, characteristics, teaching,üîΩand likewise, composition,

original: grangs dang mtshan nyid bstan pa dang // de bzhin rab byed bsdu ba dang // sgrub byed mtshungs par ldan pa ste //
analyzed: grangs dang mtshan nyid bstan pa dang // de bzhin rab byed bsdu ba dang // sgrub byed mtshungs par ldan pa ste //
translated: and establishment, and possession,

original: chos ni ngang du rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: chos ni ngang du rab tu bsgrags //
translated: are proclaimed as the nature of the Dharma.

original: yang na grub bzhin du rtsom pa ni nges pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: yang na grub bzhin du rtsom pa ni nges pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: Or, composition while established is for the sake of certainty.

original: lam gyi bden pa 'dus byas dag las bkol bas zag pa med pa nyid du grub bzhin slar yang zag pa med pa dag gi nang du smos pa ni nges bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa 'dus byas dag las bkol bas zag pa med pa nyid du grub bzhin slar yang zag pa med pa dag gi nang du smos pa ni nges bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The truth of the path is established as uncontaminated because it is not derived from the four primary elements, but it is mentioned again among the uncontaminated to ascertain it.

original: kha cig ni dgra bcom pa'i gzugs dang ma zin pa'i gzugs zag pa med par 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni dgra bcom pa'i gzugs dang ma zin pa'i gzugs zag pa med par 'dod de /
translated: Some say: The form of an arhat and noncompounded form are uncontaminated.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas dag las lam gyi bden pa dag kho na zag pa med pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas dag las lam gyi bden pa dag kho na zag pa med pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is ascertained that only the truth of the path is uncontaminated among conditioned states, but others are not.

original: de bzhin du kha cig brtags pa'i 'gro ba 'gog pa kho na 'dus ma byas dang zag pa med par khas len gyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no //üîΩde ni 'dus byas yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig brtags pa'i 'gro ba 'gog pa kho na 'dus ma byas dang zag pa med par khas len gyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no // de ni 'dus byas yin te /
translated: Similarly, some assert that only the cessation of the investigated realm is unconditioned and uncontaminated, but space is not.

original: sgra de tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is conditioned because it arises from mere sound.

original: brtags pa ma yin pa ni khas mi lan pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa ma yin pa ni khas mi lan pa nyid do //
translated: It is not investigated because it is not asserted.

original: gzhan dag ni 'dus ma byas gsum char btags par khas lan gyi rdzas su ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dus ma byas gsum char btags par khas lan gyi rdzas su ma yin no //
translated: Others assert that the three types of unconditioned states are investigated but not substantially existent.

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa bsal du zin kyang 'dus @217a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa bsal du zin kyang 'dus @217a * //
translated: Therefore, though it is established that unconditioned states are not contaminated, it is not established that they are uncontaminated.üîΩ

original: ma byas nyid dang zag ba med pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid du khas blangs par shes par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩ'dus ma byas rnam gsum yang ste //
analyzed: ma byas nyid dang zag ba med pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid du khas blangs par shes par bya ba'i phyir / 'dus ma byas rnam gsum yang ste //
translated: Therefore, although it has been determined that the unconditioned is not subject to contamination, in order to show that it is accepted as unconditioned, as not subject to contamination, and as a real entity,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúThe unconditioned is threefold.‚Äù

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the purpose of exclusion,

original: lugs gzhan dgag par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum kho na'o zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: lugs gzhan dgag par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum kho na'o zhes ston par byed do //
translated: because it is taught that there are only three types.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang 'dus ma byas nyid du 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang 'dus ma byas nyid du 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because some believe that dependent origination is an unconditioned entity.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa smos pa ni tshor ba rnam par bcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa smos pa ni tshor ba rnam par bcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the noble truths is for the purpose of excluding feeling.

original: bstan pa 'di ni phal che ba'am gtso bo yin te gzhan du na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa so sor brtags pa'i 'gog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni phal che ba'am gtso bo yin te gzhan du na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa so sor brtags pa'i 'gog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaching is the most common or principal one, because otherwise the cessation that is attained by the mundane path would not be analytical cessation.

original: de la ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las grub ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las grub ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four great elements that are not conjoined are the cause of this.üîΩFor example, it is like the hand and the bracelet.

original: lag pa dang lag chings lta bu'o zhes bya ba la gal te ngag gi sgra ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lag pa dang lag chings lta bu'o zhes bya ba la gal te ngag gi sgra ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the sound of speech is not a cause derived from the four great elements that are conjoined,

original: dper na tshangs par 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pas smras pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa skyes pa rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed lta bu ste /üîΩrnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //
analyzed: dper na tshangs par 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pas smras pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa skyes pa rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed lta bu ste / rnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //
translated: then why is it like the speech of Brahma who is said to belong to the desire realm and the indicative form of speech of those born in the second absorption?

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na //üîΩyod mod kyi 'di ni nges pa med de /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na // yod mod kyi 'di ni nges pa med de /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúSpeech is accompanied by investigation and analysis.‚ÄùüîΩIt is not definite that speech is a cause derived from the four great elements that are conjoined.

original: dpe nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpe nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the example itself is accepted.

original: 'di ltar lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu kho na las 'byung ba yin zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ma yin no gnod par byed pa'i grang ba med kyi phan par byed pa ni yod do lo zhes bya ba la
analyzed: 'di ltar lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu kho na las 'byung ba yin zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ma yin no gnod par byed pa'i grang ba med kyi phan par byed pa ni yod do lo zhes bya ba la
translated: Some say: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that there is no cold that harms, but there is that which benefits.

original: kha cig na re lo'i sgra ni ting nge 'dzin las tha dad pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa khas ma blangs par gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re lo'i sgra ni ting nge 'dzin las tha dad pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa khas ma blangs par gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that a separate benefit is not accepted, but it is for the purpose of clarifying that.

original: kha cig ni de dag gi ltar na bsam gtan dang po na rnam par shes pa tshogs gsum gyi bde bas phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni de dag gi ltar na bsam gtan dang po na rnam par shes pa tshogs gsum gyi bde bas phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say: According to them, pleasure would not benefit the first absorption since it is the pleasure of the three collections of consciousness.

original: gzhan dag na re de ni shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba'i reg bya'i khyad par las gzhan pa'i reg pa phan 'dogs par byed pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de ni shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba'i reg bya'i khyad par las gzhan pa'i reg pa phan 'dogs par byed pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: There is no benefit from contact other than a special tactile object called pliancy.

original: yul mnyam zhing za bar 'dod pa med na rten gang g-yer ba de sngar skye'o //
analyzed: yul mnyam zhing za bar 'dod pa med na rten gang g-yer ba de sngar skye'o //
translated: If the object is the same and there is no desire to eat, then the one who is satisfied generates it first.

original: g-yengs dang sems med kyis ngag gi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byas la /
analyzed: g-yengs dang sems med kyis ngag gi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byas la /
translated: It is distinguished from verbal informative form by the distracted and mindless states.

original: rjes 'brel gyi ni lus kyi rig byed las khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: rjes 'brel gyi ni lus kyi rig byed las khyad par du byas so //
translated: It is distinguished from physical informative form by the subsequent state.

original: gnyid dang brgyal ba sems med par khas ma blangs ba'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir mig 'du shes med pa dang @217b 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms bar zhugs pa'i yang yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyid dang brgyal ba sems med par khas ma blangs ba'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir mig 'du shes med pa dang @217b 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms bar zhugs pa'i yang yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is also said to be that of one who has entered the meditative attainment of nondiscernment or the meditative attainment of cessation, because it is not accepted that sleep and fainting are mindless states and because there is no nonindicative form in the state of nondiscernment.

original: sems med pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems med pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is taught that the two meditative attainments are the only mindless states.

original: slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i gsung rnams yin no snyom du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i gsung rnams yin no snyom du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The words of the master are the words of the Teacher.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te rten gzugs su yod pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ltar gzugs nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rten gzugs su yod pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ltar gzugs nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the eye consciousness, etc. were form, like non-revealing form, because their basis is form,

original: de lta na de'i rten gzugs su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gzugs nyid ma yin par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na de'i rten gzugs su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gzugs nyid ma yin par yang 'gyur na /
translated: then, in that case, some would not be form, because their basis is not form.

original: gcig la chos can phan tshun 'gal ba 'du ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la chos can phan tshun 'gal ba 'du ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible for mutually contradictory properties to inhere in a single basis,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: like permanence and impermanence.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de lta na rten tha dad du 'gyur ba ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na thams cad gzugs su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de lta na rten tha dad du 'gyur ba ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na thams cad gzugs su yod pa yin no //
translated: But non-revealing form does not have a different basis, because it is not form.üîΩBut if it is form, then it is not non-revealing.

original: de lta bas na 'dra bar thal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dra bar thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the consequence that everything would be form does not apply.

original: sha dang lha dang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gsum gyi spyod yul pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sha'i mig ni bdag cag lta bu rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sha dang lha dang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gsum gyi spyod yul pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sha'i mig ni bdag cag lta bu rnams kyi'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the domain of the three eyes‚Äù means that the three eyes are the fleshly eye, the divine eye, and the eye of wisdom. The fleshly eye is that of ordinary beings like ourselves.

original: lha ni lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lha ni lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: The divine eye is that of the gods.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ste zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ste zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The eye of noble wisdom is the uncontaminated knowledge of the noble ones.

original: sha'i mig ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sha'i mig ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The fleshly eye focuses on all phenomena.

original: lha'i mig ni gzugs kyi yul can kho na'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig ni gzugs kyi yul can kho na'o //
translated: The divine eye focuses on form alone.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di nyid /üîΩspyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: phung po la sogs gtam re yin // zhes bya ba 'di nyid / spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
translated: Each is a topic of aggregates and so on.

original: zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan te /
analyzed: zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan te /
translated: This is taught by another enumeration:üîΩAs antidotes to the conduct of beings.

original: gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por mi 'gyur ba'i phung po bstan pa de ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por mi 'gyur ba'i phung po bstan pa de ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because there is no aggregate teaching that is not an antidote to the afflictions.

original: lo'i sgra ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun reg pa med pa'i phyir bsags pa la gdon mi za bar bu ga yod par 'gyur bas ma rangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun reg pa med pa'i phyir bsags pa la gdon mi za bar bu ga yod par 'gyur bas ma rangs pa'i don to //
translated: The term lo is used because it is unacceptable that atoms do not touch each other, since it is certain that there would be spaces between them.

original: gzhan dag na re bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say this is the word of the Vaibhasikas.

original: 'o na khams brgyad po thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir chos kyi khams bzhin du ston pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khams brgyad po thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir chos kyi khams bzhin du ston pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if all eight elements are objects of the cognition of selflessness, they would be like the phenomena element and have a teacher.

original: mi 'gyur te de dag ni rang gi byed pa la ltos nas ston pa dang bcas pa de dang mtshungs pa nyid du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te de dag ni rang gi byed pa la ltos nas ston pa dang bcas pa de dang mtshungs pa nyid du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not like that, because they are posited as having a teacher in dependence on their own function.

original: dri la sogs pa de dag ni gang dag gcig gis 'dzin pa de dag gzhan gyis mi 'dzin te //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa de dag ni gang dag gcig gis 'dzin pa de dag gzhan gyis mi 'dzin te //
translated: Those objects such as smell that are apprehended by one sense faculty are not apprehended by another.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are apprehended through contact.

original: de phyir @218a * //
analyzed: de phyir @218a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du de dag kyang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du de dag kyang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: like the eye faculty and so on, they are not shared.

original: 'di la smra ba gcig gi sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la res 'ga' zhig rkyen nye na de dag nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sna la sogs pa'i
analyzed: 'di la smra ba gcig gi sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la res 'ga' zhig rkyen nye na de dag nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sna la sogs pa'i
translated: In this regard, some say: The odors, etc., that produce the consciousnesses of nose, etc., of a single speaker are not common to others, because sometimes, when the conditions are close, they are not perceived by others.

original: yul du skyes pa ni de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyes par 'gyur ba de ni yod kyi /
analyzed: yul du skyes pa ni de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyes par 'gyur ba de ni yod kyi /
translated: But when they are born as objects of the nose, etc., of others, the consciousnesses of nose, etc., of others are produced.

original: gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan lta ba ni nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan lta ba ni nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the eyes of one person never see the forms that are the objects of the eyes of another.

original: yul thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects are not common.

original: mu stegs byed kha cig na re sgra rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i rim pas rna bar 'ongs par rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rna ba ni yul dang phrad pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kha cig na re sgra rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i rim pas rna bar 'ongs par rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rna ba ni yul dang phrad pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas say: The ear is only in contact with its object field, because it is understood that sound reaches the ear through the progression of the continuity of sound.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te lag bar bcangs pas dril bu'i sgra 'gags ma thag tu sgra mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te lag bar bcangs pas dril bu'i sgra 'gags ma thag tu sgra mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because when one claps the hands, the sound of the clap is not heard immediately after the sound of the clap ceases.

original: de zhig kyang 'ga' zhig par nas chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ong pa'i sgra de 'dzin pa sus bzlog / de'i phyir dril bu'i yul na gnas pa'i sgra kho na 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: de zhig kyang 'ga' zhig par nas chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ong pa'i sgra de 'dzin pa sus bzlog / de'i phyir dril bu'i yul na gnas pa'i sgra kho na 'dzin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the sound is grasped only as existing in the place of the bell,

original: chu rlabs kyi tshul du rna 'brug gi bu gar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chu rlabs kyi tshul du rna 'brug gi bu gar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not as going into the ear-hole like a wave in water.

original: skad cig mar 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba la sgyu smras pa ni skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig mar 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba la sgyu smras pa ni skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs claim that it is contradictory to grasp the sound as momentary is refuted by the statement, ‚ÄúIt would remain in the next moment.‚Äù

original: reg pa'i skad cig ma ni skyes pa'i skad cig pas 'phyi ba yin te /
analyzed: reg pa'i skad cig ma ni skyes pa'i skad cig pas 'phyi ba yin te /
translated: The moment of contact is later than the moment of arising,

original: bdag nyid thob ma thag tu phan tshun reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thob ma thag tu phan tshun reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because immediately after attaining its own nature, it contacts the other.

original: skad cig mar gnas pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir reg pa'i dus su 'gag pa'i phyir mi rig go //
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir reg pa'i dus su 'gag pa'i phyir mi rig go //
translated: It does not remain for a moment, because it ceases at the time of contact, and therefore it is not cognized.

original: res 'ga' ni mnyam zhes ni mi brjod de tshad nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mnyam zhes ni mi brjod de tshad nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not said that sometimes it is equal, because the measure is not ascertained.

original: yang na ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: Or else, it should be said:

original: gang gi tshe rna ba'i nang du thos pa de'i tshe mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rna ba'i nang du thos pa de'i tshe mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one hears sound within the ear, it is equal.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gong ma ni mig gi ma yin te zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gong ma ni mig gi ma yin te zhes bya ba /
translated: Also, the higher consciousness is not of the eye.

original: 'dir yang rang gis pa dang sa gong ma khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rang gis pa dang sa gong ma khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, one would have to accept that it is of its level and the higher level.

original: ji ltar sa 'og ma'i gzugs sa gong ma'i mig gi yul ma yin pa de bzhin du sa gong ma'i rnam par shes pa yang sa 'og ma'i mig gis rten par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar sa 'og ma'i gzugs sa gong ma'i mig gi yul ma yin pa de bzhin du sa gong ma'i rnam par shes pa yang sa 'og ma'i mig gis rten par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the form of a lower level is not the object of the eye of a higher level, so too the consciousness of a higher level would not be supported by the eye of a lower level,

original: rang gi rten dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rten dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object and its support engage one object together.

original: 'di na lha tshangs pa la sogs pa mthong pa'i phyir dang / de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa skye pa'i phyir 'di ni 'byed par bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di ni rgol ba'i gzhi yin no zhes /
analyzed: 'di na lha tshangs pa la sogs pa mthong pa'i phyir dang / de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa skye pa'i phyir 'di ni 'byed par bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di ni rgol ba'i gzhi yin no zhes /
translated: This is a basis for debate: ‚ÄúBecause one sees gods such as Brahma, and because consciousness arises by their power, this must be analyzed.‚Äù

original: sprul pa'i gzugs mthong ba'i phyir na 'di ni dpyad zin to //
analyzed: sprul pa'i gzugs mthong ba'i phyir na 'di ni dpyad zin to //
translated: This has already been analyzed because one sees emanated form.

original: gnas dang po'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: gnas dang po'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: This is the commentary on the first chapter.

original: // / @218b pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang bral ba ni za ma rnams te 'byin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / @218b pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang bral ba ni za ma rnams te 'byin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are devoid of the male and female faculties are eunuchs, because they are incapable of sexual intercourse.

original: de nyams pa ni ma ning rnams te gnod pas nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams pa ni ma ning rnams te gnod pas nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are defective in that faculty are hermaphrodites, because they are defective due to injury.

original: mtshan gnyis pa ni gnyis ka nyams pa ste gnas nyams pa'i phyir dang bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa ni gnyis ka nyams pa ste gnas nyams pa'i phyir dang bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have both faculties are those who have both male and female organs. They are defective in both faculties, because the organs are defective, and because they are the cause of little pleasure.

original: mtshan gnyis pa ni dbang po gnyis bde 'gro na dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa ni dbang po gnyis bde 'gro na dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How can those who have two organs have a happy rebirth, since that is the ripened result of virtue?

original: de'i phyir bde 'gro na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde 'gro na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIn the happy realms, etc.‚Äù

original: bde 'gro ste mi dag gi nang nas mi dge ba'i las kyis dbang po gnyis po de mi 'tsham pa'i gnas su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: bde 'gro ste mi dag gi nang nas mi dge ba'i las kyis dbang po gnyis po de mi 'tsham pa'i gnas su skyes pa yin te /
translated: In the happy realms, among humans, those who have two organs are born in an improper place due to nonvirtuous karma.

original: de ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: That is a non-mental formation.

original: dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'i yin te /
translated: The organs are only virtuous, because they are part of the body faculty.

original: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du bde 'gro na gcig tu dge ba kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du bde 'gro na gcig tu dge ba kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: Like the faculty of body, it has only a virtuous karmic maturation in the happy realms.

original: nyi 'og pa ni yid mi bde ba yang dge mi dge lung ma bstan gsum char du 'dod do //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa ni yid mi bde ba yang dge mi dge lung ma bstan gsum char du 'dod do //
translated: But outsiders assert that mental dissatisfaction has three types: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i rgyu ni de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i rgyu ni de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cause of nonregression is one who is free from attachment to it and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gnyis kyis thob par byas pas de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni brtan pa yin te /üîΩ'bras las nyams 'gyur /üîΩdang po las yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gnyis kyis thob par byas pas de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni brtan pa yin te / 'bras las nyams 'gyur / dang po las yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is free from attachment to it is stable because it is obtained by both the mundane and transcendent paths.üîΩOne who is free from attachment to the summit of existence is free from attachment to the entire realm of desire.üîΩOne who is free from attachment to the summit of existence is free from attachment to the entire realm of desire.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar yin te de'i phyir gdon mi za bar lus kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar yin te de'i phyir gdon mi za bar lus kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: The path of seeing exists in the desire realm alone, and therefore one definitely possesses the body faculty.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la nges pa la 'jug pa'i tshe yid mi bde ba mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la nges pa la 'jug pa'i tshe yid mi bde ba mi srid do zhe na /
translated: When one definitely enters freedom from attachment, mental dissatisfaction is impossible.

original: de'i phyir tshor ba bzhi dag dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba bzhi dag dang zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore the root text states, ‚Äúone who possesses four feelings.‚Äù

original: lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: But it is not definite that they possess the remaining faculties.

original: de dag dang 'brel pa'i 'dir pho dang mo'i dbang po dag kyang gang rung zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rgol ba'i tshig ni brjod par mi bya ste 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel pa'i 'dir pho dang mo'i dbang po dag kyang gang rung zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rgol ba'i tshig ni brjod par mi bya ste 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not necessary to mention here the male and female faculties, which are included among the faculties.

original: res 'ga' ni rim gyis 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su dbang po 'gags kyang de'i tshe skye ba skye zhing nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rim gyis 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su dbang po 'gags kyang de'i tshe skye ba skye zhing nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes, when the faculties cease in the context of gradual death, the faculty of birth arises and engages its object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mo yin pa la mo'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mo yin pa la mo'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, is it possible for a female to not possess the female faculty?

original: yod do zhes brjod de mo'i dbang po 'gags kyang de'i ris mthun pa mi 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod do zhes brjod de mo'i dbang po 'gags kyang de'i ris mthun pa mi 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that it is possible, because even when the female faculty ceases, the homogeneous collection of parts does not cease.

original: pho'i dbang po yang de 'da'o //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po yang de 'da'o //
translated: The same applies to the male faculty.

original: de ltar na yang sems gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa gnyis mi 'thad de phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang sems gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa gnyis mi 'thad de phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not tenable that both coarse and subtle faculties exist in a single mind, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re sems gcig la dmigs shing rdzas mnyam yang mthu dus gzhan yin @219a * //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re sems gcig la dmigs shing rdzas mnyam yang mthu dus gzhan yin @219a * //
translated: Master Sa·πÖghasena says that they focus on the same mind and are of equal substance, but their power is at different times.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyir 'gal pa med de /üîΩtshogs la rtog pa'i mthus bla lhag na ni dpyod pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir sems rtsing bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: pa'i phyir 'gal pa med de / tshogs la rtog pa'i mthus bla lhag na ni dpyod pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir sems rtsing bar 'gyur la /
translated: Master Sanghabhadra says: Though they are the same substance and focus on one mind, they are not contradictory because their power is different.üîΩIf the power of investigation is stronger than the power of conception, then the mind becomes coarse because the power of investigation weakens.

original: dpyod pa'i mthu bla lhag na ni rtog pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i mthu bla lhag na ni rtog pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: If the power of investigation is weaker than the power of conception, then the mind becomes subtle because the power of conception weakens.

original: tsha dang chu grang reg bzhin no //üîΩ'dir gang zhig mthu shas che ba de ni sa dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: tsha dang chu grang reg bzhin no // 'dir gang zhig mthu shas che ba de ni sa dang mtshungs la /
translated: They are like the contact of heat and cold water.

original: gang zhig shas chung ba de ni chu dang mtshungs pas dpe la mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig shas chung ba de ni chu dang mtshungs pas dpe la mi mthun pa med do //
translated: Here, whatever has greater power is like earth and whatever has less power is like water, so there is no contradiction with the example.

original: de ltar na rtog pa dpyod pa cig car ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pa dpyod pa cig car ba yin la /
translated: Thus conception and investigation are simultaneous.

original: sems rtsing ba de nyid zhib pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems rtsing ba de nyid zhib pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The mind that is coarse is not subtle.

original: sa'i bye brag gis ni 'dod pa'i khams na rtog pa kho na yod la /
analyzed: sa'i bye brag gis ni 'dod pa'i khams na rtog pa kho na yod la /
translated: In the desire realm, only conception exists,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na dpyod pa kho na yod cing bar na gnyis ka yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na dpyod pa kho na yod cing bar na gnyis ka yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the summit of cyclic existence, only investigation exists.üîΩIn the intermediate state, both exist.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag gis ni sa thams cad na gnyis ka yang yod mod kyi 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po gnyis kho na na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag gis ni sa thams cad na gnyis ka yang yod mod kyi 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po gnyis kho na na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In all the stages, both exist, but not in the desire realm and the first two meditations.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs ni slar yang sems rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid ni sems rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid do zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs ni slar yang sems rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid ni sems rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid do zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra does not say that coarseness and subtlety of mind are coarseness and subtlety of mind.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: sems rtsing ba ni sems la yod pa'i rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: sems rtsing ba ni sems la yod pa'i rtsing ba'o //
translated: Coarseness of mind is coarseness that exists in the mind.

original: de'i dngos po ni sems rtsing ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni sems rtsing ba nyid do //
translated: Its state is coarseness of mind.

original: sems zhib pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems zhib pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Subtlety of mind is also like that.

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //
translated: No one possesses space.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation.

original: nam mkha' dang ni gang yang 'brel pa med de dgag par bya ba dang 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni gang yang 'brel pa med de dgag par bya ba dang 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Space is not related to anything, because there is nothing to be refuted and no refutation.

original: de'i 'di la thob pa med do //
analyzed: de'i 'di la thob pa med do //
translated: There is no attainment here.

original: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five branches are abandoned.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga dag spangs par 'gyur zhing yongs su shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga dag spangs par 'gyur zhing yongs su shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The five fetters that are associated with the lower realms are abandoned and completely known.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems so //

translated: Others say: The near is the cause, the distant is the condition.üîΩThe other is that which is not included.

original: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho bo cag gis ni skye ba la sogs pa kho na bshad de /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho bo cag gis ni skye ba la sogs pa kho na bshad de /
translated: Here we explain that only arising and so on are included.

original: de dag gi don du 'dir nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi don du 'dir nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the purpose of this chapter and are included here.

original: ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la rgyu yang @221a * //üîΩyin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la rgyu yang @221a * //üîΩyin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: That which is not included is that which is not only the cause of the afflicted view of the self, but also that which is its effect.

original: gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes mi 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur zhes khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes mi 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur zhes khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Those who do not recite the line ‚Äúthe phenomena concomitant with it‚Äù should be asked this: how do you interpret the text of the treatise?

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the correct interpretation?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dag ma gtogs zhes de skad du 'don te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dag ma gtogs zhes de skad du 'don te /
translated: The correct interpretation is stated in the line ‚Äúexcept for the arising, aging, and enduring of the afflicted view of the self.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ni sems mi skyed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ni sems mi skyed de /
translated: The reason is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause they do not generate mind through the power of their arising and so on.‚Äù

original: de rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no /üîΩde'i phyir / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyis //
analyzed: de rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no / de'i phyir / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyis //
translated: This is because they are like the intrinsic characteristics of those phenomena.

original: zhes de skad mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes de skad mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the correct interpretation is stated in the line ‚Äúthe phenomena concomitant with it.‚Äù

original: thob pa dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir na phung po gcig go //
analyzed: thob pa dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir na phung po gcig go //
translated: Obtainment and the arising and so on of those phenomena are subsumed by the aggregate of formation, so they are one aggregate.

original: thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pas 'bras bu gcig go //
analyzed: thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pas 'bras bu gcig go //
translated: The result of the obtainment of the first is the result of the arising, etc. of the first, and so on.

original: thob pa rnams kyi thob pa dang ldan 'bras bu tha dad pa de mtshan nyid rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thob pa rnams kyi thob pa dang ldan 'bras bu tha dad pa de mtshan nyid rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The obtainment of the obtainment of the first is a separate result, but the characteristics are not.

original: mtshan gzhi dang gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are coemergent causes of the characterized object and the characteristics.

original: phung po gnyis la zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag las dga' ba dang mi dga' ba ni gzugs kyi phung po yin la /
analyzed: phung po gnyis la zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag las dga' ba dang mi dga' ba ni gzugs kyi phung po yin la /
translated: The body and speech that are the basis of pleasure and pain are the form aggregate.

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin no //
translated: The arising, etc. of those are the formation aggregate.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gcig kho na yin te /
translated: The single maturational result of the body and speech, and the arising, etc. of those is the coemergent cause.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory that a separate result is a coemergent cause.

original: 'du shes med pa pa yang sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin pa'i phyir gsum gyis yin par rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa yang sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin pa'i phyir gsum gyis yin par rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Also, since the state of composure without conception has an equivalent immediately preceding mind, isn‚Äôt it logical that it arises from three conditions?

original: 'di brjod par bya ba yin mod kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas sems kyi 'du byed las skyes pa ma yin pa des na ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'di brjod par bya ba yin mod kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas sems kyi 'du byed las skyes pa ma yin pa des na ma brjod do //
translated: This is indeed something to be discussed, but it is not mentioned because it arises from the natural inclination of the mind that is born from karmic maturation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang zhes bya ba 'byung ba la dge ba gang gi mjug thogs su dge ba gang dang gang gis bsdus pa 'byung zhe na /üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba las byung ba kho na yin gyi skyes nas thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang zhes bya ba 'byung ba la dge ba gang gi mjug thogs su dge ba gang dang gang gis bsdus pa 'byung zhe na / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba las byung ba kho na yin gyi skyes nas thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When it is said that virtuous minds arise from the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, what is the meaning of this?üîΩThe meditative attainment of nondiscernment is subsumed by the virtuous mind that arises from preparation.

original: 'dir skyes pas mngon du byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir skyes pas mngon du byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not subsumed by the virtuous mind obtained from birth because it cannot be manifested by one who is born in this realm.

original: kha cig na re mi lcogs pa med pa kho nas bsdus pa 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re mi lcogs pa med pa kho nas bsdus pa 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is subsumed by the unrestricted access concentration alone.

original: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan dang @221b po'i yang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan dang @221b po'i yang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is also the fourth absorption.

original: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan khyad par can gyi yang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan khyad par can gyi yang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is also the special absorption.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs na re bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs na re bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Gho·π£aka says: It is up to the second absorption.

original: gzhan dag na re mnyam par gzhag pas thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sas bar du chod pa 'dren par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mnyam par gzhag pas thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sas bar du chod pa 'dren par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It cannot be drawn up to the second absorption because it is obstructed by the levels, just as the meditative attainment of alternating meditative attainment is obstructed by the levels.üîΩSix arise from the final state of the base of skill.

original: bzo'i gnas pa'i mjug thogs su ni drug ste zhes bya ba la 'di ltar de la gnas pa la 'chi ba med de /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas pa'i mjug thogs su ni drug ste zhes bya ba la 'di ltar de la gnas pa la 'chi ba med de /
translated: In this way, one who abides in that state does not die.

original: de lta ma yin na gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag sus bzlog tu yod /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag sus bzlog tu yod /
translated: If that were not so, who could stop the afflicted states of the form and formless realms?

original: gal te mi slob pa las slob pa mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te mi slob pa las slob pa mi 'byung na /
translated: If a learner does not arise from a nonlearner,

original: 'o na ji ltar na mi slob pa las yongs su nyams pa slob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na mi slob pa las yongs su nyams pa slob pa yin zhe na /
translated: then how does a learner arise from a nonlearner who has degenerated?

original: 'di ltar langs pa mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar langs pa mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, they fall from the meditative stabilization of no more learning.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, there is no falling away from abiding in meditative stabilization.

original: gnas gnyis pa'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: gnas gnyis pa'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter, having eight verses, called ‚Äúthe examination of the elements.

original: // / chu bur can la sogs pa grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad ni yang sos la sogs pa rnams kyi ngos bzhi de dag gi 'khor lhag pa lta bur gnas te /
analyzed: // / chu bur can la sogs pa grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad ni yang sos la sogs pa rnams kyi ngos bzhi de dag gi 'khor lhag pa lta bur gnas te /
translated: The eight cold hells, such as Arbuda, are located below the Reviving Hell and so on, like a surrounding wall.

original: des na gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir grang ba'i dmyal ba rnams logs shig tu ma bstan la /
analyzed: des na gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir grang ba'i dmyal ba rnams logs shig tu ma bstan la /
translated: Since they are not primary, the cold hells are not mentioned separately.

original: nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba rnams kyang yul dang grangs dang tshad ma nges pa logs shig tu ma smos so //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba rnams kyang yul dang grangs dang tshad ma nges pa logs shig tu ma smos so //
translated: The occasional hells are not mentioned separately because their location, number, and size are indefinite.

original: thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they fall from hearing and are attached to that.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams ni de ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul sems kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed do zhes nas de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skye la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams ni de ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul sems kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed do zhes nas de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skye la /
translated: Yogis who desire this emanate a desire realm emanation through a desire realm emanating mind.üîΩThen attachment to that emanation arises and they degenerate from freedom from attachment to desire realm objects.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams te rjes su dran nas sprul pa'i sems la chags par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams te rjes su dran nas sprul pa'i sems la chags par byed do //
translated: Again, attachment to the emanating mind arises through recalling the emanation.

original: yang sprul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang sprul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Through the power of emanation, attachment to the emanating mind arises.üîΩWhen seeing a desire realm emanation, they think, ‚ÄúAlas! I wish I had such a mind.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa mthong nas kye ma kyi hud bdag la yang 'di 'dra ba'i sems yod par gyur cig snyam du sprul pa'i sems la yang 'dod pa nyon mongs pa can 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa mthong nas kye ma kyi hud bdag la yang 'di 'dra ba'i sems yod par gyur cig snyam du sprul pa'i sems la yang 'dod pa nyon mongs pa can 'byung ngo //
translated: Afflicted attachment to the emanating mind arises.

original: gal te bdag cag ni des so snyam pa dang / 'di dag bdag gis snyam du 'du shes tha dad pa'i phyir 'du shes du ma pa yin no snyam na rgyu'i 'du shes tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: gal te bdag cag ni des so snyam pa dang / 'di dag bdag gis snyam du 'du shes tha dad pa'i phyir 'du shes du ma pa yin no snyam na rgyu'i 'du shes tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa med de /
translated: If you think that they have multiple discernments because they have different discernments, thinking I am this and they are that, then they do not have multiple discernments because their causal discernments are not different.

original: de dag thams cad tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba la zhen pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re 'od gsal @222a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba la zhen pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag na re 'od gsal @222a * //
translated: All of them are attached to the view that holds ethics and modes of conduct to be paramount.

original: na gnas pa dag kho nas bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sprul pa sprul nas tshangs pa dang lhan cig bsdad la /
analyzed: na gnas pa dag kho nas bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sprul pa sprul nas tshangs pa dang lhan cig bsdad la /
translated: Others say: Those abiding in Abhasvara emanate emanations of the first absorption and then abide together with Brahma.

original: sprul pa'i gnas skabs dang yang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de dag gi de'i sa pa'i mngon par shes pa'i yul yin pas de dag gis sprul pa'i gnas skabs dran pas de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par shes par 'gyur roüîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i gnas skabs dang yang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de dag gi de'i sa pa'i mngon par shes pa'i yul yin pas de dag gis sprul pa'i gnas skabs dran pas de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par shes par 'gyur roüîΩzhes zer ro //
translated: Since the object of the higher perception of those born in the first absorption is the state of emanation, they recall the state of emanation and think, We are this.

original: gzhan dag ni bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ni tshangs pa'i lo ka pa kho na yin pas de dag nyams su myong ba dran pa mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ni tshangs pa'i lo ka pa kho na yin pas de dag nyams su myong ba dran pa mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Others say: The eye consciousness of those born in the second absorption and so on is only the eye consciousness of Brahmapurohita. Therefore it is not impossible that they recall experiencing it.

original: de'i phyir sngar mthong ba kho na rjes su dran pa yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩkha cig na re sems can 'di yang 'di snyam du smon la bdag kyang 'dir skyes so snyam du bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar mthong ba kho na rjes su dran pa yin no zhes zer ro // kha cig na re sems can 'di yang 'di snyam du smon la bdag kyang 'dir skyes so snyam du bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: Therefore they recall only what they previously saw.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The knowledge recalling former existences that arises from meditating on the aspiration may this sentient being also be born here is not the knowledge of death and rebirth or the knowledge of others minds.

original: 'o na ci zhe na skyes nas thob pa kho nas de snyam du shes pas 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na skyes nas thob pa kho nas de snyam du shes pas 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: What is it then? It is knowledge that arises from birth alone.üîΩOthers say: The knowledge of death and rebirth is not inferential knowledge, since it is knowledge that arises from birth alone.

original: gzhan dag na re rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi bsam pa rnam pa dang bcas pa rtog pas gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi bsam pa rnam pa dang bcas pa rtog pas gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The knowledge of death and rebirth is not inferential knowledge, since it is knowledge that arises from birth alone.

original: 'ong ba dang med par 'du shes pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang med par 'du shes pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because they have the notion of coming and the notion of nonexistence.

original: skyes nas yun ring du ma lon pa rnams ni 'ong bar 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas yun ring du ma lon pa rnams ni 'ong bar 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have not been born for a long time have the notion of coming.

original: skyes nas yun ring du lon pa rnams ni med par 'du shes pa'i phyi ro //
analyzed: skyes nas yun ring du lon pa rnams ni med par 'du shes pa'i phyi ro //
translated: Those who have been born for a long time have the notion of nonexistence.

original: skrag pa dang mi skrag par 'du shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: skrag pa dang mi skrag par 'du shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Because they have the notion of fear and the notion of no fear.

original: skrag pa ni skyo ba'i 'chi 'pho bar dogs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: skrag pa ni skyo ba'i 'chi 'pho bar dogs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Fear is the notion of death, because of the fear of being disgusted with and passing away from that realm.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ma spangs ba'i phyir de dag la de yod do //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ma spangs ba'i phyir de dag la de yod do //
translated: That fear exists for them because they have not abandoned the grasping of a self.

original: sa gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba las gzhan gyi phung po rnams ni mngon du gyur pa yin yang rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i bya ba mi byed de /
analyzed: sa gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba las gzhan gyi phung po rnams ni mngon du gyur pa yin yang rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i bya ba mi byed de /
translated: The consciousness does not abide in the aggregates of another realm, even though they are manifest.

original: srid pa kun du spyod pa'i dbang gis na de la rnam par shes pa rab tu gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: srid pa kun du spyod pa'i dbang gis na de la rnam par shes pa rab tu gnas pa yin na /
translated: Consciousness abides there because of the power of the universal activity of existence.

original: de dag la srid pa kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la srid pa kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not practice existence.

original: rgyud gzhan dag dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dag ni rang gi sa pa yin yang /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dag dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dag ni rang gi sa pa yin yang /
translated: Beings of other realms and those who are not counted as sentient beings, even though they belong to their own realm,

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: are not abodes of consciousness.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag kyang rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag kyang rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin te /
translated: Others say that they are abodes of consciousness,

original: de la yang rnam par shes pa nye bar brlan pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par shes pa nye bar brlan pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because consciousness is moistened and grows in them.

original: kha cig @222b na re yi dags rnams ni brdzus te skyes pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig @222b na re yi dags rnams ni brdzus te skyes pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that hungry ghosts are born spontaneously.

original: de'i phyir yi dags mngal nas skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi dags mngal nas skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to prove that hungry ghosts are also born from a womb, the text says, ‚ÄúThe venerable Maudgalyayana saw a hungry ghost born from a womb.

original: skye gnas thams cad du skyes pa rnams la 'phags pa'i chos thob pa'i go skabs yod mod kyi /
analyzed: skye gnas thams cad du skyes pa rnams la 'phags pa'i chos thob pa'i go skabs yod mod kyi /
translated: ‚Äù It is possible for noble ones to obtain the noble Dharma in all the modes of birth.

original: 'phags pa'i chos thob zin pa rnams ni sgo nga dang drod gsher las skyes pa'i gnas su mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos thob zin pa rnams ni sgo nga dang drod gsher las skyes pa'i gnas su mi skye'o //
translated: Those who have obtained the ƒÅrya dharmas are not born in the wombs of eggs or moisture.

original: sngon dus kyi srid pa'i sha tshugs can yin yang rnam par smin pa'i snying po dang po yin pa'i phyir dang / srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon dus kyi srid pa'i sha tshugs can yin yang rnam par smin pa'i snying po dang po yin pa'i phyir dang / srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba med pa yin te /
translated: Even though they have the form of an intermediate being of the prior time, they have complete faculties because they are the first stage of the maturation of karmic maturation and because they seek rebirth.

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mi brtan pa gcad pa'i phyir te mi brtan pa ni @226a * //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mi brtan pa gcad pa'i phyir te mi brtan pa ni @226a * //

analyzed: bdag po med pa'i zhes bya ba ni bu med pa'i gter te yul gyi bdag po las ma byin par blangs so //

original: gnyis ka yang mi byed na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang mi byed na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If neither is done,

analyzed: de ltar na bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin du las kyi lam sems tsam la rag las pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: then it follows that, like the absorptions and uncontaminated vows, the karmic path would depend on the mind alone.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam par rig byed med pa can ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam par rig byed med pa can ni yod pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i rig byed ma yin pa las khyad par du byed pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar na de gnyis las kyi lam du 'grub ces bya ba ni drang srong dang dge slong gnyis kyi'o //

analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs ni drang srong dag ni don gyis na rnam par rig byed byed pa yin te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says: The sages are actually the instigators of the informative action.

original: mi ma yin pa dag gis de dag gis bsam pa 'dor bar zhugs pa rtogs nas de dag la dad pa rnams gang gis na drang srong de dag la las kyi lam skye ba lus kyis byed do //

translated: When nonhumans understand that they are about to give up their intention, those who have faith in them physically perform the karmic path by which the sages are born.

analyzed: gzhan yang khro ba las ni de'i tshe gdon mi za bar lus dang ngag gi las g-yo bar 'gyur pas 'gal ba med do //

original: gso sbyong la yang ji ltar tshig gis go bar bya ba'i don la lus kyi g-yo ba la yang las kyi lam skye ba de bzhin du bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa yongs su dag go snyam du rig par bya'o snyam du cang mi smra bas mi g-yoüîΩba yang yin pas /

analyzed: tshig gis go bar bya ba'i don la cang mi smra ba la yang ngag gi las kyi lam skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ni yongs su ma dag bzhin du cang mi smra bas bdag nyid dag par go bar byed do zhes zer ro //

analyzed: gzhan ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni thams cad rnam par rig byed la rag par nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Another says: Nonindicative states of the desire realm are not necessarily concomitant with indicative form,

analyzed: sde lnga po la sogs pa 'bras bu thob pa'i mdo las so sor thar pa'i sdom pa skye ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that the vows of individual liberation arise in the five classes of beings and so on, as stated in the sutra that explains the attainment of the result.

analyzed: de lta bas na mi dge ba yang de lta bu 'ga' zhig rnam par rig byed med par yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //

original: gal te ma tshang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan pa chung ba nyid yin na dmus long la sogs pa dag la yang ches med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma tshang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan pa chung ba nyid yin na dmus long la sogs pa dag la yang ches med par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: za ma la sogs pa'i lus ni rtogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma tshang bar 'dod do //

translated: The maturation of the retinue and maturation is

translated: This is taught: Attachment and so on focus on the afflicted view of the self and so forth that focus on the truths of suffering and so on.üîΩAttachment and so on focus on the afflicted view of the self and so forth that focus on the truths of suffering and so on.

original: pa dang mthong bas spang bar bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa dang mthong bas spang bar bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the afflicted view of the self and so on are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, attachment and so on that focus on them are also to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThis is because it is said:

analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang log pa'i nga rgyal gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /

original: log pa'i nga rgyal ni sa bon med pa'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa na ni gnyis ka yod do //

translated: In the summit of existence, neither exist because there is no other realm or level.

original: 'dod chags ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis gcig tu spang par bya ba yin na de gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na ni /
