translated: At the time of the weak, among the beings of the sphere of no-thought, in Uttarakuru, and as a great Brahma.

original: chen po'i tshe ni za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: chen po'i tshe ni za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: At the time of the middling, as a eunuch, a neuter, or a hermaphrodite.

original: chen po nyid kyi tshe ni srid pa brgyad pa la sogs pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: chen po nyid kyi tshe ni srid pa brgyad pa la sogs pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
translated: At the time of the great, in the eighth existence, etc., and one obtains the non-arising of dharmas to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: mi'i nang nas 'phen par byed de /
analyzed: mi'i nang nas 'phen par byed de /
translated: One projects from among humans.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yod dam med kyang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yod dam med kyang ngo //
translated: Whether a Buddha has appeared or not.

original: sde pa gzhan dag ces bya @229b ba ni 'phags pa chos srung ba'i sde pa la sogs pa dag bden pa mngon par rtogs pa gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag ces bya @229b ba ni 'phags pa chos srung ba'i sde pa la sogs pa dag bden pa mngon par rtogs pa gcig tu brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúOther schools‚Äù refers to the Dharmaguptakas, etc., who say that the realization of the truths is all at once.

original: ji ltar zhe na kha cig gi ltar na sdug bsngal shes pa kho nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pas mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa ni skad cig ma gcig mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na kha cig gi ltar na sdug bsngal shes pa kho nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pas mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa ni skad cig ma gcig mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: According to some, the direct realization is single, in one moment, because one realizes the four noble truths by means of the single cognition of unsatisfactoriness.

original: kha cig ni skad cig ma bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni skad cig ma bzhi ste /
translated: According to others, it is four moments,

original: de dag la mnyam par bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa'i dbye ba ma byas par bden pa bzhi la shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la mnyam par bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa'i dbye ba ma byas par bden pa bzhi la shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no //
translated: like the moments of cognition of the four truths, without distinguishing the moments of the path of insight and the moments of the path of cultivation.

original: kha cig gi brgyad de /
analyzed: kha cig gi brgyad de /
translated: According to others, it is eight moments,

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba dang / chos dang rjes su shes pa'i dbye ba brgyad yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba dang / chos dang rjes su shes pa'i dbye ba brgyad yin no //
translated: because one distinguishes the truths of the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, and the cognition of the factors and the subsequent cognition.

original: kha cig gi skad gcig ma gnyis yin te skad cig ma brgyad po de dag kho na la gzhan 'jig rten pa'i shes pa bzhi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig gi skad gcig ma gnyis yin te skad cig ma brgyad po de dag kho na la gzhan 'jig rten pa'i shes pa bzhi 'byung ngo //
translated: According to others, it is two moments, because, in the course of these eight moments, four mundane cognitions arise.

original: de ltar sde pa dag gi blo tha dad par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar sde pa dag gi blo tha dad par gyur to //
translated: Thus there are different opinions among the schools.

original: bar skabs su ldang ba yod dam med ces dpyad par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bar skabs su ldang ba yod dam med ces dpyad par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be analyzed whether there is arising in the interim or not.üîΩThus a sutra states:üîΩIf one gives food to a single person who has entered the path to manifest the result of stream entry, and so on,

original: 'di ltar mdo las gang zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gcig la zas ster na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ma langs pa de ni zas zab srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las gang zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gcig la zas ster na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ma langs pa de ni zas zab srid pa ma yin no //
translated: that food is not exhausted until that person arises from that result.

original: kha cig na re rkyen ma tshang bas bar skabs su ltung ba yod ces zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rkyen ma tshang bas bar skabs su ltung ba yod ces zer ro //
translated: Some say: There is falling in the interim due to incomplete conditions.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re na med de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re na med de /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: There is no falling.

original: srid pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shing s'a la dang / gso sbyong bstan pa ltar yongs su brtag pa nye bar brtag pa bzung ste gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shing s'a la dang / gso sbyong bstan pa ltar yongs su brtag pa nye bar brtag pa bzung ste gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Buddha taught this in terms of the possibility of existence, like the teaching on the sala tree and the observance of purification.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sa 'og ma la brten te zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la thug pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sa 'og ma la brten te zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la thug pa ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the third absorption and who is free from attachment to lower levels, that is, from unrestricted access concentration up to the second absorption,

original: gang yang rung ba zhig ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig ste /
translated: It is one who is born in the desire realm.

original: de dag la bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na zhig ste /
translated: He is born in the desire realm alone,

original: gang na mthong lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang na mthong lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path of seeing does not exist there.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam bsam gtan gsum pa'i zag pa med pa mngon du byed do //üîΩde lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes pa bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa de'i gong ma bsam gtan bzhi pa 'am /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam bsam gtan gsum pa'i zag pa med pa mngon du byed do // de lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes pa bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa de'i gong ma bsam gtan bzhi pa 'am /
translated: He definitely manifests the uncontaminated path of the special stage of the third absorption.üîΩIf that were not so, then the arya born in the third absorption or above would not possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: gzugs med pa dag tu skyes pa'i 'phags pa de bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes nis 'phos pas bsam gtan gsum pa zag pa dang bcas pa btang @230a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag tu skyes pa'i 'phags pa de bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro // des nis 'phos pas bsam gtan gsum pa zag pa dang bcas pa btang @230a * //
translated: Because he would abandon the contaminated third absorption through relocating to the fourth absorption or the formless realm.

original: la des zag pa yang mngon du ma byas pas bde ba'i dbang po zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gnyis ka dang mi ldan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: la des zag pa yang mngon du ma byas pas bde ba'i dbang po zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gnyis ka dang mi ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: And because he would not manifest the contaminated third absorption, he would not possess both the contaminated and uncontaminated faculty of pleasure.

original: 'phags pa khong du skyes pa ni gdon mi za bar bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa khong du skyes pa ni gdon mi za bar bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan par gsungs te /
translated: It is said that those born in the higher realms definitely possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo mi ldan gyi 'phags pa ni ldan no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo mi ldan gyi 'phags pa ni ldan no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is not possessed by ordinary beings born in the fourth absorption or the formless realm, but it is possessed by ƒÅryas.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i nang du bris pa yod mod kyi de ni gzhan pa'i phyogs yin par mngon te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i nang du bris pa yod mod kyi de ni gzhan pa'i phyogs yin par mngon te /
translated: Others say: Although this is written in the Abhidharma, it is clearly the position of another school.

original: gzhan dag na re ni zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says ‚Äúothers say.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad par zad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad par zad do zhes zer ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúƒÅryas possess the faculty of pleasure‚Äù is explained from the perspective of existence.üîΩOthers say: It is due to the characteristics of other abodes.

original: gzhan dag na re ni gnas gzhan gyis mtshan mas so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni gnas gzhan gyis mtshan mas so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: This is unacceptable.

original: de dag ni log par rtog pa'i dbang gis dam pa ma yin pa'i las dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni log par rtog pa'i dbang gis dam pa ma yin pa'i las dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage in nonvirtuous actions due to the power of wrong views.

original: dam pa ma yin pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa ni mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i byed pa de mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i sems kyis byed na 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag ni mi dge ba
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa ni mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i byed pa de mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i sems kyis byed na 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag ni mi dge ba
translated: Those who are holy do not engage in the nonvirtuous, because they have abandoned nonvirtue.üîΩIf one engages in nonvirtue, such as sexual misconduct, with a nonvirtuous mind, then those who are free from attachment do not engage in nonvirtue, because they have abandoned nonvirtue.

original: spangs pa'i phyir dam pa kho na la 'jug gi dam pa ma yin pa la ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: spangs pa'i phyir dam pa kho na la 'jug gi dam pa ma yin pa la ni mi 'jug go //
translated: They only engage in the holy, not the nonholy.

original: mnyam par brtsi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhi na dgu dgur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par brtsi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhi na dgu dgur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are counted equally means that they are counted as nine in each of the four absorptions.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa'i bye brag gis dgur brtsi na ni de lta na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa'i bye brag gis dgur brtsi na ni de lta na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are counted as nine due to the specific abandonment of the nine types of affliction, then they would be counted as unequal,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na dgu pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na dgu pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ninth type does not exist in the fourth absorption.

original: de'i rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Those free from attachment to the ninth stage of the fourth absorption proceed to the formless realm.

original: 'dir gong du 'pho ba yang gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba gzung gi / gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gong du 'pho ba yang gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba gzung gi / gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, also refers to those who proceed to the form realm, but not to those who proceed to the formless realm.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bsam gtan pa ni rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma bgrangs te de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bsam gtan pa ni rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma bgrangs te de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this context, those who are absorbed in the fourth absorption and free from attachment to the ninth stage are not counted, because they proceed to the formless realm.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i rnam pa lnga la gzugs med pa gsum na rnam pa gnyis gcig dang / gnyis bzhi dang nyi shu yod pa'i gzhan 'dor lugs bshad nas /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i rnam pa lnga la gzugs med pa gsum na rnam pa gnyis gcig dang / gnyis bzhi dang nyi shu yod pa'i gzhan 'dor lugs bshad nas /
translated: The five vajra like aspects are explained as the system of discarding the other two, one, two, four, and twenty aspects in the three formless realm meditative attainments.

original: yang ci'i phyir sa gzhan gyi 'gog pa kho na la dmigs kyi srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba ltar @230b sa gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sa gzhan gyi 'gog pa kho na la dmigs kyi srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba ltar @230b sa gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do they focus on the truth of cessation of other levels alone and not on the truths of other levels such as the truth of suffering and origin of the summit of existence?

original: sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir te de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad ni lus so //
analyzed: sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir te de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad ni lus so //
translated: Because they are free from attachment to lower levels. Therefore the eight aspects of the summit of existence are the body.

original: yang ci'i phyir rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma kho na'i 'gog pa la dmigs kyi bsam gtan bzhin du sa 'og ma la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma kho na'i 'gog pa la dmigs kyi bsam gtan bzhin du sa 'og ma la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does it focus on the truth of cessation of its own level and higher levels, but not on lower levels like the absorptions?

original: sa 'og ma'i sdug bsngal la ma dmigs par de'i 'gog pa la dmigs par mi nus so //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i sdug bsngal la ma dmigs par de'i 'gog pa la dmigs par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot focus on the truth of cessation without focusing on the truth of suffering of lower levels.

original: sdug bsngal yang zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad yin la /üîΩgzugs med dngos gzhi dge ba yi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad yin la / gzugs med dngos gzhi dge ba yi //
translated: Suffering is all contaminated states.

original: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma yin //
analyzed: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma yin //
translated: The formless realm is not the domain of contaminated lower levels.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang rgyu yin no //
translated: This is also a reason.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni kun du lta ba'i phyir mi dgag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni kun du lta ba'i phyir mi dgag ste /
translated: The absorptions are not blocked because they are all-seeing.

original: bsam gtan dge yul yod dgu min //
analyzed: bsam gtan dge yul yod dgu min //
translated: The absorptions are not all objects of virtue.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩrdo rje lta bu gnyis gnyis la bzhi gnyis kyis bsnan nas bcu bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // rdo rje lta bu gnyis gnyis la bzhi gnyis kyis bsnan nas bcu bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.üîΩThe vajra like concentrations are fourteen, since two are added to each of the two sets of seven explained previously.

original: de bzhin du sngar bshad pa dag la gnyis dang / bzhi bsnan nas gsum gnyis dang gnyis bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar bshad pa dag la gnyis dang / bzhi bsnan nas gsum gnyis dang gnyis bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, two and four are added to the three previously explained, making five and six.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs med dag rang dang gong ma'i sa pa'i gnyen po kho na la dmigs par 'dod pa bshad kyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs med dag rang dang gong ma'i sa pa'i gnyen po kho na la dmigs par 'dod pa bshad kyi /
translated: Why are formless states asserted to focus on the antidote alone of their own level and higher levels?üîΩ

original: sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Why are formless realm states asserted to focus on their own level and higher levels alone, but not on lower levels?

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes la sogs pa las yang dag par 'das par gsungs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes la sogs pa las yang dag par 'das par gsungs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is said that they completely transcend the discernment of form and so on.

original: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po'i sgo nas ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po'i sgo nas ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because they focus on the antidotes of lower levels, they focus on the antidotes of lower levels.

original: 'o na sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: 'o na sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: But if that is so, then it is said that they focus on the antidotes of lower levels,

original: de ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: because they are mutually concomitant.

original: de na khyad par du ma byas pas rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam dgu po ni sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: de na khyad par du ma byas pas rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam dgu po ni sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad kyi /
translated: That is explained as follows: The nine types of subsequent knowledge that do not specify their level focus on the antidotes of lower levels.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pas sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs so zhes khyad par du byas nas ni ma bstan la /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pas sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs so zhes khyad par du byas nas ni ma bstan la /
translated: It is not taught that they focus on the antidote of lower level since they are subsumed by the base of infinite space and so on.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin zhes pa'i tshul bstan pa 'di bsam gtan gyis pa dag kho na la yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin zhes pa'i tshul bstan pa 'di bsam gtan gyis pa dag kho na la yin no //
translated: This explanation that they focus on the antidote of lower level is only for those of the absorptions.

original: thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they obtain one result subsumed by that obtainment.

original: thob pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong bas bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong bas bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they obtain one result subsumed by the obtainment of once return and nonreturn.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩgang gi phyir mthong @231a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / gang gi phyir mthong @231a * //
translated: Therefore a sutra states:

original: ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they obtain one result subsumed by the obtainment of all results of the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they obtain the uncontaminated obtainment of freedom.

original: 'jig rten pa yis chags bral ba'i //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis chags bral ba'i //
translated: The mundane path does not

original: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
analyzed: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
translated: Noble beings possess both types of obtainment of freedom.üîΩ

original: zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bshad de /
translated: The noble ones have two types of obtainment of freedom.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa de la bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa brgya dang 'dra ba dag skye la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa de la bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa brgya dang 'dra ba dag skye la /
translated: Thus, the obtainment of freedom from the contaminated state of the result of the mundane path is similar to the uncontaminated obtainment of freedom.

original: de dag gi spangs pa 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi spangs pa 'dzin par byed do //
translated: They maintain the abandonment of those.

original: 'di ltar pho bang 'khor ba'i rdzas yin yang rgyal po'i phyag rgyas btab pa gang yin pa de ni yang gang gis 'phags pa de'i yin par brjod pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar pho bang 'khor ba'i rdzas yin yang rgyal po'i phyag rgyas btab pa gang yin pa de ni yang gang gis 'phags pa de'i yin par brjod pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, although the substances of the palace are the property of the king, those that are sealed with the king‚Äôs seal are not said to belong to anyone else.

original: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of that means by the power of the uncontaminated obtainment of freedom.üîΩBecause there is no death without losing the result.

original: yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dir yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'di yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dir yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'di yin par 'dod de /
translated: Here, this is asserted to be complete possession.

original: 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
analyzed: 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
translated: There is no death without losing the result.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And so on.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ltar 'chi ba zhig na yongs su nyams pa de ni 'chi ba med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ltar 'chi ba zhig na yongs su nyams pa de ni 'chi ba med do //
translated: Otherwise, they would die like those who are free from attachment to the desire realm, but they do not die.

original: rigs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this so-called lineage?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is the root of virtue.

original: de'i bye brag gis 'di bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis 'di bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: This is a specific case because it is a specific type of lineage.üîΩSautrantikas say: It is the potency of the seed of the mind.

original: mdo sde pa rnams ni sems kyi sa bon gyi dngos po'i nus pa yin te yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon yod pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams ni sems kyi sa bon gyi dngos po'i nus pa yin te yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon yod pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who possesses the attribute of complete degeneration has the seed of complete degeneration in the state of an ordinary being.

original: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs su sa bon de'i 'jug pa rnyed pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs su sa bon de'i 'jug pa rnyed pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: One who possesses the attribute of complete degeneration in the state of a nonlearner is called one who possesses the attribute of complete degeneration because the seed is obtained when it manifests.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One who possesses the attribute of death and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: This is the one who is a follower by faith.

original: ji ltar dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas brtsis pa bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o ;
analyzed: ji ltar dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas brtsis pa bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o ;
translated: Just as the follower by faith is counted by means of faculty, lineage, path, freedom from attachment and basis, so too should the follower by faith be counted.

original: / ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang sbyor ba'i rnam par grol ba rnams la ni dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir rigs kyi khyad par med la /
analyzed: / ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang sbyor ba'i rnam par grol ba rnams la ni dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir rigs kyi khyad par med la /
translated: The term ‚Äúin a similar way‚Äù means that the follower by faith, the one obtaining results by insight and the one liberated according to circumstances do not differ in terms of lineage because they are of sharp faculty.

original: dad mos mthong thob ni rtul po yin pas yod do //
analyzed: dad mos mthong thob ni rtul po yin pas yod do //
translated: But the one resolute in faith and the one obtaining results by insight are of dull faculty.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral pa ni 'di nga mi rtsi ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral pa ni 'di nga mi rtsi ste /
translated: One freed from attachment to the summit of existence is not counted here.

original: mthong @231b ba'i lam gyi snga rol du 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong @231b ba'i lam gyi snga rol du 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, prior to the path of insight, there is no freedom from attachment to the summit of existence through the mundane path.

original: yang na phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Or else, he is free from attachment to one part.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rgyun chags pa yin te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rgyun chags pa yin te /
translated: The subsequent cognition of the path is uninterrupted.

original: de'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa lhag ma ni khyad par gyi lam mo ;
analyzed: de'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa lhag ma ni khyad par gyi lam mo ;
translated: The rest, with the exception of its first moment, is the path of advancement.

original: / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rgyun chags pa gzhan yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rgyun chags pa gzhan yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: The uninterrupted path of the path of cultivation should be stated in the same way as the uninterrupted path of insight.

original: dper na zad pa shes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i mthong pa'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam gsum ma gtogs pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zad pa shes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i mthong pa'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam gsum ma gtogs pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the cognition of exhaustion, etc., and likewise, the three paths that produce the bliss of the present life of the perfected being and the qualities of excellence, with the exception of the cognition of exhaustion, etc.

original: gnas drug pa'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: gnas drug pa'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixth chapter, having six verses, called ‚Äúthe examination of the faculties.

original: // /'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes su ma yin zhes bya ba la gal te 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa mi ldan pa la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin na de lta na rjes su shes pa yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyenüîΩpor 'dod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: // /'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes su ma yin zhes bya ba la gal te 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa mi ldan pa la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin na de lta na rjes su shes pa yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen por 'dod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: If it is the antidote of the form and formless realms because it focuses on the truths of cessation and path that are not possessed, then it should be asserted that subsequent knowledge is the antidote of the desire realm.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te shes pa rnams ni rno ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi yul la bya ba byas te gzhan gyi yul la bya ba byed pa dag yin la /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te shes pa rnams ni rno ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi yul la bya ba byas te gzhan gyi yul la bya ba byed pa dag yin la /
translated: That is not so, because knowledge is sharp and it acts on its object and then acts on another object.

original: gong na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir gnyen por rigs na /
analyzed: gong na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir gnyen por rigs na /
translated: If it is logical that it is an antidote because it abandons the remaining objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the higher realms,

original: rjes su shes pa la ni 'dod pa'i khams na bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa la ni 'dod pa'i khams na bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then subsequent knowledge does not act on the desire realm at all.

original: chos shes pas bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos shes pas bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because Dharma knowledge has already completed all action.

original: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams gong ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa la ni yul gzhom par bya ba la bya ba yod de /
analyzed: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams gong ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa la ni yul gzhom par bya ba la bya ba yod de /
translated: Those that pervade all realms that are not of the same realm as the mind are objects of the higher realm, because they are objects of higher realm minds.

original: dgra pham par bya ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas 'joms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra pham par bya ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas 'joms pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the desire to conquer an enemy, which is the basis for conquering.üîΩThe treatise declares:

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni gal te kun bsdus pa gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni gal te kun bsdus pa gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is concomitant with sleep, it would contradict the treatise.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩIt says: One accurately knows the mind that is contracted.

original: sems kun bsdus pa yang dag pa ji la ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'byung ste rgyas par ni 'grel ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kun bsdus pa yang dag pa ji la ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'byung ste rgyas par ni 'grel ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The commentary explains this in detail.

original: ji ltar rjes su shes pa kun bsdus pa la dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su shes pa kun bsdus pa la dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: How could subsequent knowledge focus on the contracted mind?

original: 'dod pa'i khams las gong na gnyid med pa'i phyir la rjes su shes pa yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las gong na gnyid med pa'i phyir la rjes su shes pa yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sleep does not exist above the desire realm and because subsequent knowledge focuses on the form and formless realms.

original: lam shes pa yang kun bsdus pa'i sems la dmigs par mi 'gyur @232a * //
analyzed: lam shes pa yang kun bsdus pa'i sems la dmigs par mi 'gyur @232a * //
translated: The knowledge of the path does not focus on the mind associated with sleep.

original: ro ; / ci'i phyir zhe na lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: ro ; / ci'i phyir zhe na lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Why? Because the knowledge of the path focuses on the path,

original: gnyid ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and sleep is solely contaminated.

original: lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems ni gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems ni gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The mind subsumed by the path is not concomitant with sleep.

original: kun bsdus pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir zhes sngar ji ltar bshad pa ltar ni ji skad smras pa'i skyon med de /
analyzed: kun bsdus pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir zhes sngar ji ltar bshad pa ltar ni ji skad smras pa'i skyon med de /
translated: As previously explained, there is no fault in the statement that the mind subsumed by sleep is distracted because it is subsumed by sleep due to focusing on the object of sleep,

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas bsdus pa yang yin la rnam par g-yengs pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas bsdus pa yang yin la rnam par g-yengs pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but it is not distracted because it is not concomitant with afflicted sleep.

original: bstan bcos dang yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is also no contradiction with the treatise.

original: kun bsdus pa'i sems dge ba ni khams gsum gyis bsdus pa dang ma bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir kun bsdus pa'i sems la shes pa de ni shes bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: kun bsdus pa'i sems dge ba ni khams gsum gyis bsdus pa dang ma bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir kun bsdus pa'i sems la shes pa de ni shes bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: Because virtuous minds subsumed by the three realms and not subsumed by the three realms are objects of that knowledge, it is established that knowledge of that subsumed mind is introspection.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i kun bsdus pa'i sems dge ba la dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa yin la zag pa med pa'i shes pa dge ba'i sems la dmigs pa lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa ni lam shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i kun bsdus pa'i sems dge ba la dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa yin la zag pa med pa'i shes pa dge ba'i sems la dmigs pa lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa ni lam shes pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge of subsequent states focuses on virtuous minds subsumed by the form and formless realms and knowledge of the truth of path focuses on virtuous uncontaminated minds subsumed by the truth of path.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because afflicted states do not obtain similar states in the future.

original: lugs las chos dge ba 'dus byas thob pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lugs las chos dge ba 'dus byas thob pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that virtuous conditioned phenomena obtain their obtainment in accordance with the system.

original: phung po gsum gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po dag gis so //
analyzed: phung po gsum gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po dag gis so //
translated: It is accompanied by the three aggregates, i.e., by the aggregates of sensation, ideation and formations.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dag gis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dag gis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not accompanied by the aggregate of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa de nyid rnam par shes pa'i 'khor yin pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de nyid rnam par shes pa'i 'khor yin pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: for it is not logical that consciousness is the retinue of consciousness.üîΩThe wholesome is accompanied by a large retinue,

original: dge ba ni 'khor mang ba yin la zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa dang mngon par shes pa 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni 'khor mang ba yin la zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa dang mngon par shes pa 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the acquisition of future similar qualities and the superknowledges.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir spong ba'i lam yin la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir spong ba'i lam yin la /
translated: The uninterrupted path is the path of elimination because it is the antidote to the defilements.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam yin te /
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is the path of liberation,

original: rnam dgu rnam grol blo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam dgu rnam grol blo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the cognition of liberation is ninefold.

original: gzhan dag na re khyad par gyi lam yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khyad par gyi lam yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is also the special path.

original: nus pa ni bsil ba dang dro ba nyid do //
analyzed: nus pa ni bsil ba dang dro ba nyid do //
translated: Their potency is heat and cold.

original: rnam par smin pa ni mngar ba dang skyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni mngar ba dang skyur ba nyid do //
translated: Their maturation is sweet and sour.üîΩSince the higher perceptions of the eye and ear are neutral, the liberated paths of those higher perceptions are neutral.

original: mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag gi rnam par grol ba'i lam lung du ma bstan pa yin la @232b chos lung du ma bstan pa la ni ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa med de /üîΩlung bstan min 'thob lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag gi rnam par grol ba'i lam lung du ma bstan pa yin la @232b chos lung du ma bstan pa la ni ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa med de / lung bstan min 'thob lhan cig skyes //
translated: But future states are not obtained for neutral phenomena.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Future states are obtained simultaneously.

original: mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam la yang shes pa gsum kho na 'thob ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam la yang shes pa gsum kho na 'thob ste /
translated: One obtains three knowledges on the liberated paths of the three higher perceptions.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'o //
translated: They are knowledge of the domain of the superknowledges, knowledge recalling past lives and knowledge of the extinction of contaminants.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is the term and so on said?

original: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / zad par la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dag gi bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de la yang kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / zad par la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dag gi bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de la yang kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob ste /
translated: The future conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds are obtained on the liberated paths of the absorptions that establish qualities such as the higher perceptions, subjugation, and totalities.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated because the knowledge of others' minds is subsumed by the actual basis of absorption.

original: so so'i skye bo 'dod pa dang bsam gtan las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la kun rdzob shes pa dang sems shes pa gnyis 'thob po //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'dod pa dang bsam gtan las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la kun rdzob shes pa dang sems shes pa gnyis 'thob po //
translated: Ordinary beings obtain both conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds on the final liberated path free from attachment to the desire realm and the absorptions.

original: yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ci'i phyir mi smos she na /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ci'i phyir mi smos she na /
translated: Why is freedom from attachment to the fourth absorption not mentioned?

original: de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin la gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa med de sems shes pa gzugs la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan gyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin la gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa med de sems shes pa gzugs la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan gyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the base of infinite space, but the knowledge of others' minds is not included in the formless realm because the knowledge of minds is established in dependence on form and it is a level of absorption.

original: sred med kyi bu'i stobs zhes bya ba'i stobs kyi ming gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: sred med kyi bu'i stobs zhes bya ba'i stobs kyi ming gi khyad par ro //
translated: The specific name of the third power is the power of knowledge of the strength of the nƒÅga.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase according to the time should be applied to all.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩyun shin tu ring ba dang thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin na sku tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / yun shin tu ring ba dang thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin na sku tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin la /
translated: How is that?üîΩBecause he lives for a very long or short time.üîΩWhen the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years, his lifespan is eighty thousand years.

original: tshe lo brgya pa yin na tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe lo brgya pa yin na tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When the lifespan is one hundred years, his lifespan is one hundred years.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The two access concentrations of the second absorption and so on are excluded.

original: de dag ni zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas spyod yul gong ma dang 'og ma la nges pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bdun mi 'byin no ;
analyzed: de dag ni zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas spyod yul gong ma dang 'og ma la nges pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bdun mi 'byin no ;
translated: They do not eliminate the seven arya paths because they are definitely lower and higher objects since they engage their objects in the aspects of peace, coarseness and so on.

original: / gzhan dag na re byams pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas 'byung po thams cad la bdag dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re byams pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas 'byung po thams cad la bdag dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Others say: Love is the wish that all beings be happy, like oneself.

original: snying rje ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la mngon par mi dga' ba'o //üîΩdga' ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa dag gis dga' ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la mngon par mi dga' ba'o // dga' ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa dag gis dga' ba'o //
translated: Compassion is the wish that all beings be free from suffering.üîΩJoy is the wish that all beings not be separated from happiness.

original: btang snyoms ni phan pa dang gnod pa dag la de'i rgyu mtshan dag la mi gtod pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni phan pa dang gnod pa dag la de'i rgyu mtshan dag la mi gtod pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the wish that all beings be free from attachment and aversion.üîΩThe order is as stated in the Abhidharmakosa:

original: grangs bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog gi gnyen po ni bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par thar pa yin la /
analyzed: grangs bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog gi gnyen po ni bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par thar pa yin la /
translated: The first liberation is the form of the beautiful.üîΩThe second is the liberation of the formless.üîΩThe third is the liberation of the formless.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags kyi gnyen por ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i rnam par thar pa yin te ;
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags kyi gnyen por ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i rnam par thar pa yin te ;
translated: The fourth is the liberation of the formless.üîΩThe fifth is the liberation of the formless.üîΩThe sixth is the liberation of the formless.üîΩThe seventh is the liberation of the formless.üîΩThe eighth is the liberation of the formless.

original: rnam par thar pa 'di gnyis kyang thag bsring ba'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa 'di gnyis kyang thag bsring ba'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These two liberations should be understood as the antidote of distancing.

original: smras pa bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na kha dog gi 'dod chags med do zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: smras pa bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na kha dog gi 'dod chags med do zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that there is no attachment to color in the second absorption and above?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no eye consciousness.

original: gang zhig yul gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni nges par 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig yul gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni nges par 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
translated: One who is free from attachment to an object is also free from attachment to the apprehending consciousness.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pas de'i phyir de dag ni kha dog gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar grub bo //üîΩkha @235a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pas de'i phyir de dag ni kha dog gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar grub bo // kha @235a * //
translated: Since eye consciousness and so on do not exist in the second absorption and above, it is established that one is free from attachment to color there.

original: cig na re kha dog bzang po rnams la chags pa mi skye la /
analyzed: cig na re kha dog bzang po rnams la chags pa mi skye la /
translated: Some say: Attachment to good color does not arise.

original: kha dog ngan pa rnams la khong khro ba mi skye ba ste 'dir zil gyis gnon pa'i ni 'di yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha dog ngan pa rnams la khong khro ba mi skye ba ste 'dir zil gyis gnon pa'i ni 'di yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: and one does not generate anger toward ugly colors.

original: gzhan dag na re de lta yin na zil gyis gnon pa rnams ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de lta yin na zil gyis gnon pa rnams ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: According to others, if that were so, then the subjugations would be by nature nonattachment and nonhatred.

original: de'i phyir 'dir don ni kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa rnams zil gyis mnan nas kha dog ngan pa ji lta bar kha dog bzang po rnams kyang de 'dra bar mi sdug pa'i rnam par ro gcig par byas nas mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir don ni kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa rnams zil gyis mnan nas kha dog ngan pa ji lta bar kha dog bzang po rnams kyang de 'dra bar mi sdug pa'i rnam par ro gcig par byas nas mthong ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning here is that one sees the subjugation of good and bad colors, making them the same in the aspect of ugliness, as if they were bad colors.

original: 'di'i sems la dbang ba ni 'di yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sems la dbang ba ni 'di yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the subjugation of mind.

original: zil gyis mnan nas zhes pa ni shes bya'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas zhes pa ni shes bya'o //
translated: The subjugation should be understood as the subjugation of the object.

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnal 'byor rdzogs pa dag go //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnal 'byor rdzogs pa dag go //
translated: The subjugation of seeing is the completion of yoga that has that as its object.

original: brgyad kyi spyod yul ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched yin no //
analyzed: brgyad kyi spyod yul ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched yin no //
translated: The domain of the eight is the form base that occurs in the desire realm.

original: ji ltar zad par 'byung ba'i skye mched rnams kyi dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zad par 'byung ba'i skye mched rnams kyi dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched yin zhe na ;
translated: Why is the object of the bases of mastery the form base?

original: sa la sogs pa rnams dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa rnams la khyad par yod pas 'di dag 'di dag zad par sa la sogs pa'i skye mched ces bya'i zad par sa'i khams la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa rnams la khyad par yod pas 'di dag 'di dag zad par sa la sogs pa'i skye mched ces bya'i zad par sa'i khams la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since there is a difference between earth and so on and the earth element and so forth, they are called the bases of mastery of earth and so on, but not the bases of mastery of the earth element and so on.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams kyang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin pas de rnams gzugs kyi skye mched kyi yul can nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams kyang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin pas de rnams gzugs kyi skye mched kyi yul can nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since earth and so on are by nature color and shape, it is not contradictory that they are the objects of the form base.üîΩSome say: Wind is the tangible object base.

original: kha cig na re rlung ni reg bya'i skye mched yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dag rlung gzugs su 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re rlung ni reg bya'i skye mched yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dag rlung gzugs su 'ong ba'o //
translated: This is because wind is form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
translated: Therefore the first chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa states:üîΩWind is the air element.

original: rlung tshogs khams nyid yin zhes bshad de de'i lugs kyis so //
analyzed: rlung tshogs khams nyid yin zhes bshad de de'i lugs kyis so //
translated: This is according to their system.

original: yang / gang dag de dang 'dra ba'ang yin //
analyzed: yang / gang dag de dang 'dra ba'ang yin //
translated: Also, those that are similar to that

original: zhes bya ba de'i lugs kyis ni sa la sogs pa ltar rlung gzugs kyi skye mched kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i lugs kyis ni sa la sogs pa ltar rlung gzugs kyi skye mched kho na yin te /
translated: According to that system, like earth and so on, wind is the form base.üîΩ

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: According to this system, like earth and so on, wind is the form base since it has the nature of color and shape.

original: ji ltar gang du khyad du par 'phags she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang du khyad du par 'phags she na /
translated: How are they distinguished?

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa tsam dang zil gyis gnon pa dang zad par byed pa'i phyir de ltar gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa yin no ;üîΩ/ de nyid kyi phyir zad par gyi skye mched thob pa des gdon mi za bar gzhan dag kyang thob ste /
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa tsam dang zil gyis gnon pa dang zad par byed pa'i phyir de ltar gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa yin no ; / de nyid kyi phyir zad par gyi skye mched thob pa des gdon mi za bar gzhan dag kyang thob ste /
translated: They are distinguished as superior to the others in the order presented, since they are superior in terms of the number of objects, the number of aspects, the number of moments, the number of bases, the number of realms, the number of aspects of subjugation, the number of aspects of elimination and so on.

original: yon tan rim gyis 'dzeg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rim gyis 'dzeg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, one who obtains the bases of subjugation and bases of totality necessarily obtains the others, because one ascends to higher qualities.üîΩOthers say: The liberations and so on are distinguished by being small, medium and great.

original: gzhan dag na re chung du dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad pa'i rnam par thar pa la sogs pa phye ste de lta yin yang rnam par thar pa rnams kyi rgyu kho na yin la zad par gyi skye @235b mched rnams ni 'bras bu kho na yin
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chung du dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad pa'i rnam par thar pa la sogs pa phye ste de lta yin yang rnam par thar pa rnams kyi rgyu kho na yin la zad par gyi skye @235b mched rnams ni 'bras bu kho na yin
translated: Even though that is so, the liberations are the cause and the bases of subjugation and bases of totality are the result.

original: zhing / zil gyis gnon pa rnams ni gnyis ka yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩrgyu dang las kyi stobs kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs med pa skye'i chos nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhing / zil gyis gnon pa rnams ni gnyis ka yin no zhes zer ro // rgyu dang las kyi stobs kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs med pa skye'i chos nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of the summit of existence are both.üîΩFormless states arise in the form and formless realms through the power of cause and karma, but not through the power of reality.

original: 'jig pa'i dbang gis gzugs med pa dag tu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dbang gis gzugs med pa dag tu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not arise in the formless realm through the power of reality because they do not arise in the formless realm through the power of degeneration.

original: chos nyid kyi zhes bshad pa chos nyid ces bya ba 'di gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi zhes bshad pa chos nyid ces bya ba 'di gang zhig ce na /
translated: The term reality is mentioned in the Abhidharmako≈õa, but what is reality?

original: re zhig mdo sde pa kha cig na re chos 'jug pa shas che ba de dag nyid sngon gyi bsam gtan gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis lung med par bsam gtan skye ba dang mthun pa ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: re zhig mdo sde pa kha cig na re chos 'jug pa shas che ba de dag nyid sngon gyi bsam gtan gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis lung med par bsam gtan skye ba dang mthun pa ni chos nyid de /
translated: Some SautrƒÅntikas say: Reality is the natural and intrinsic state of those who have a strong propensity for Dharma to generate the absorptions through the power of past latent propensities for absorption, even without oral instruction.

original: rang bzhin dang dngos po nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang dngos po nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: This is equivalent to saying that it is their nature and intrinsic state.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sngon gyi bsam gtan bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi dbang gis thos pa rgyas pa la de dag mthun pa'i chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sngon gyi bsam gtan bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi dbang gis thos pa rgyas pa la de dag mthun pa'i chos nyid yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is due to the power of virtuous Dharmas previously cultivated in absorption that learning increases.

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni chos nyid yin zhes bya'o zer ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni chos nyid yin zhes bya'o zer ro //
translated: That which is concordant with them is reality.

original: gzhan dag na re lung 'dzin par byed pa ni smra bar byed pa sgrub par byed pa ste rten yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lung 'dzin par byed pa ni smra bar byed pa sgrub par byed pa ste rten yin te /
translated: Others say: One who upholds scripture is one who speaks and establishes it and is its basis.

original: lung phyin ci ma log pa'i rten ni sgrub ba po rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung phyin ci ma log pa'i rten ni sgrub ba po rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who establish it are the basis of unmistaken scripture.

original: rtogs par smra bar byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par smra bar byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: One who speaks of realization is one who establishes it.

original: de'i phyir ji srid du sgrub par byed pa yod pa de srid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i dam pa'i rjes su chos gnas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid du sgrub par byed pa yod pa de srid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i dam pa'i rjes su chos gnas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, as long as there are those who establish it, the holy Dharma that is called realization endures.

original: rtogs pa ni de lta bu yin gyi zhes bya ba ni lo stong du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni de lta bu yin gyi zhes bya ba ni lo stong du gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù is like that, lasting for a thousand years.

original: lung ni yun ring du gnas so zhes bya ba ni stong gi phyi nas kyang bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lung ni yun ring du gnas so zhes bya ba ni stong gi phyi nas kyang bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe scriptures will last longer‚Äù means that they will last longer than a thousand years.

original: phyogs 'di nyid rigs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs 'di nyid rigs par mthong ngo //
translated: We see this position as reasonable.

original: da lta lung gi chos med pa ma yin gyi nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug pa rnyed pas rtogs pa'i chos ni med do //
analyzed: da lta lung gi chos med pa ma yin gyi nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug pa rnyed pas rtogs pa'i chos ni med do //
translated: The scriptures are not absent now, but the Dharma of realization is absent, since the afflictions are active and have not been found.

original: dbang gyur skye bo ni 'dir sangs rgyas kyi slob ma mngon sum du mthong ba po lung dang rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i lung gi rjes su 'brang ba rnams so //
analyzed: dbang gyur skye bo ni 'dir sangs rgyas kyi slob ma mngon sum du mthong ba po lung dang rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i lung gi rjes su 'brang ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have mastery‚Äù are the disciples of the Buddha who have seen the truth, who possess the scriptures and realization, and who follow the scriptures that are not contrary to reason.

original: lung 'bogs pa med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su smin pa la rang nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang rnyed pa na rang byung ngo //
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su smin pa la rang nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang rnyed pa na rang byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-originated‚Äù means that without the scriptures, one attains the state of omniscience by oneself through the maturation of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: rang byung gi bstan pa ni lung dang / de ston pa mdo dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa rnams so //üîΩlung dang rtogs pa dang ldan pa sems can rnams la lta bas bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i @236a * //
analyzed: rang byung gi bstan pa ni lung dang / de ston pa mdo dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa rnams so // lung dang rtogs pa dang ldan pa sems can rnams la lta bas bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i @236a * //
translated: The natural teaching is the scriptures, and the scriptures are the sutras, the vinaya, and the abhidharma, which teach that.üîΩThose who are endowed with the scriptures and the realizations, who are intent on the teaching in order to preserve it for the sake of sentient beings by means of their view, are the preservers of the teaching.

original: phyir rab tu zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni bstan pa gces 'dzin rnams te de dag kyang mchog tu zhi bar gshegs pas na zhes bya bar rjes su bsnyeg go //
analyzed: phyir rab tu zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni bstan pa gces 'dzin rnams te de dag kyang mchog tu zhi bar gshegs pas na zhes bya bar rjes su bsnyeg go //
translated: They are the ones who follow the one who has gone to supreme peace.

original: 'gro mgon ni sangs rgyas dang de'i sras rnams so //üîΩyon tan ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid de 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid dri ma rab tu 'jug pa dag gis de dag yongs su shes pa sel bar byed la /
analyzed: 'gro mgon ni sangs rgyas dang de'i sras rnams so // yon tan ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid de 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid dri ma rab tu 'jug pa dag gis de dag yongs su shes pa sel bar byed la /
translated: The protector of beings is the Buddha and his sons.üîΩThe qualities are the virtues of morality, concentration, and wisdom. The defilements, which are the essences of passion, hatred, and folly, are the enemies of those qualities.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni gegs byed pas dri ma rnams yon tan 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni gegs byed pas dri ma rnams yon tan 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: The defilements destroy the qualities by eliminating their recognition and by obstructing their future arising.

original: 'doms med ces bya ba ni 'gal bla med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'doms med ces bya ba ni 'gal bla med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúwithout a leader‚Äù means that there is no one to lead the community.

original: de ltar lkog mar srog phyin 'dra ste thub pa'i bstan pa lkog mar srog phyin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar lkog mar srog phyin 'dra ste thub pa'i bstan pa lkog mar srog phyin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The teaching of the Muni is like the throat of a lute,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyi sras po ston pa'i bstan pa bsrung bar zhugs pa rnams med pa'i phyir dang rtog ge ngan pa rnams kyis tshig dang don sgro btags pa la dkrugs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩslob dpon gang ba spel bas mdzad pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs pa zhes bya ba las snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyi sras po ston pa'i bstan pa bsrung bar zhugs pa rnams med pa'i phyir dang rtog ge ngan pa rnams kyis tshig dang don sgro btags pa la dkrugs pa'i phyir ro // slob dpon gang ba spel bas mdzad pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs pa zhes bya ba las snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba /
translated: because the sons of the Buddha, who have undertaken to protect the teaching of the Master, are no longer there, and because bad logicians have disturbed the text and the meaning by their fabrications.üîΩThis concludes the chapter on meditative attainment, the eighth chapter in the treatise called ‚ÄúAn Explanation of the Treasury of Abhidharma.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gnas brgyad pa'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: gnas brgyad pa'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: The chapter on meditative attainment is concluded.

original: // / nye ba gang dang goms pa gang //
analyzed: // / nye ba gang dang goms pa gang //
translated: What is proximate and what is cultivated?

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba las rgyud gcig la las bzhi po lci ba dang nye ba dang goms pa dang sngon du byas pa de dag yod pas de dag gi nang nas las lci ba snga ma yin pas sngar smin no //üîΩnye ba dang goms pa dang skye ba sngar byas pa rnams kyi yang nye ba snga ma yin pas de gnyis pas sngar smin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba las rgyud gcig la las bzhi po lci ba dang nye ba dang goms pa dang sngon du byas pa de dag yod pas de dag gi nang nas las lci ba snga ma yin pas sngar smin no // nye ba dang goms pa dang skye ba sngar byas pa rnams kyi yang nye ba snga ma yin pas de gnyis pas sngar smin no //
translated: In the above passage, the four types of karma are heavy, near, habitual, and former. Among them, heavy karma ripens first, because it is the first.üîΩAmong near, habitual, and former, near karma ripens first, because it is the first.

original: goms pas sngar byas pa dag las goms pa snga ma yin pas sngar smin no //
analyzed: goms pas sngar byas pa dag las goms pa snga ma yin pas sngar smin no //
translated: Among habitual and former, habitual karma ripens first, because it is the first.

original: de dag med na tshe snga ma la byas pa lan grangs gzhan la myong ba smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag med na tshe snga ma la byas pa lan grangs gzhan la myong ba smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If none of these four types of karma exist, then karma committed in a previous life that is to be experienced in another life will ripen.
